nodes.text: Huh, this is the practice area! I wonder if I can go back through the other way now that I know how this opens?

nodes.commentor: No RoguePractice greeting at this time.

nodes.text: You realize that this "Disbarred Bard" class is the "Losers" class.
I hardly think that you are a loser, my dear Kate, any more than I am.
Face the facts, Caesari, we're not good enough to be Paladins. We're not bad-assed enough to be Warriors. We're not magical enough to be Wizards and we aren't talented enough to be Bards.
We're where they put the people who don't belong in a university for Heroes.
Master von Urwald treats this class seriously. I don't believe he considers us to be losers.
Yeah, right. If this class is so good, why are we hidden away from other students in a dungeon with a teacher who looks like a villain from a play?

nodes.message: Combat dummies are not in use.

nodes.text: You should pull your arm back further before you lunge, Kate. I'll be happy to help you improve your thrust.
My name is Katie, Caesari. I may be used to swinging with a cutlass rather than stabbing with a dagger, but I'm getting the hang of this.
I think that Kate is a fine name for you, my bonny Kate. You are a lovely lady.
Of course, it is impossible to tell which of you two women is the more beautiful. You are both enchanting.
You're not very good at throwing daggers, are you?
No. I've never thrown one before coming here.
So why are you bothering to practice? You're not a sneaky, dagger sort of person. You really don't fit in with the rest of us losers.
I don't think anyone in this class is a loser. Maybe we don't fit in with the other students here, but that doesn't mean we can't be heroes.
And, yes, so maybe I'm not as skilled at daggers or fighting as most of you in class, but I'm learning. I won't stop learning until I've mastered all the skills this class teaches.
Don't let the Master get you down, Esme. So what if you failed one test? You can always do better next time.
The thief is stealing all sorts of odds and ends from around the school. I'm certain that the thief isn't one of us, and I'm pretty sure it isn't another student.
Why do you say that?
Thomas is right - something strange is running around castle at night. I have heard movement in hallway sometime after midnight.
I thought I heard something last night, but there was nothing in the corridor when I looked out.
Could it be a ghost?
Vhy vould a ghost steal pencils and food? No. The thief, it is alive.
Urwald better not test us on using grapnels or we'll all fail this class.
Ladders, I can climb. Ropes, I can walk. Climbing ropes?... not so much.
